Die Indikatoren m√ºssen mit Vorsicht und im Lichte der Screening-Aktivit√§ten, des Gesundheitskontextes und der Merkmale der Bev√∂lkerung (Alter, Bev√∂lkerungsdichte, Risikofaktoren usw.) interpretiert werden, aber auch der Qualit√§t der Daten und der H√§ufigkeit ihrer Meldung, die in ihrer Gesamtheit analysiert werden m√ºssen. Der effktive R-Wert wird √ºber ein 7-Tage-Fenster von T-9 bis T-3 berechnet. Die Daten werden am Dienstag gestoppt und einmal pro Woche (am Donnerstag) ver√∂ffentlicht. Der effektive R-Wert ist auf nationaler Ebene (Frankreich Mutterland) und auf regionaler Ebene (Mutterland- und √úberseeregionen) verf√ºgbar. Alle anderen Indikatoren werden t√§glich aktualisiert, nach Konsolidierung durch SpF und das Ministerium f√ºr Solidarit√§t und Gesundheit. Auf nationaler Ebene werden die Inzidenzrate und die Positivit√§tsrate bei T-3 gestoppt und auf den Durchschnitt der letzten 7 Tage [T-9; T-3] berechnet, um ihre Schwankungen besser ber√ºcksichtigen zu k√∂nnen. Die Anzahl der Neuerkrankungen ist ein Indikator, der bei T-1 gestoppt wird, also ohne die notwendige R√ºckschau und Kontextualisierung, um zu best√§tigen, dass er die Gesundheitssituation vollst√§ndig abbildet.

notification.lowRisk.title: Info: stay alert

risk.section.measures.title: The preventive measures
risk.section.measures.body: Be sure to follow the preventive measures to stop the spread of the virus.
risk.section.mcc.title: Mes Conseils Covid
risk.section.mcc.body:
Find personalized advice on prevention and care on the Mes Conseils Covid website.

Mes Conseils Covid is a service of the Minist√®re des Solidarit√©s et de la Sant√©
risk.section.limit.title: Limit your contacts
risk.section.limit.body: Be sure to limit your contact, in particular with people at risk of severe disease.
risk.section.test.title: Get tested
risk.section.test.body:
You have priority access to the test. It is recommended that you get tested immediately and 7 days after your contact date.

To find out which day is the most suitable for you to be tested according to your situation, update your status in the "Isolation recommendation" module.

Contact your doctor in case of doubt.

If you do not have a doctor, call 0 800 130 000 to be referred to a doctor (free service + free call).
risk0.section.test.title: Where to get tested
risk0.section.test.body: To find out where to get tested, go to Sant√©.fr
risk.section.symptoms.title: In case of symptoms
risk.section.symptoms.body:
If in doubt, do not hesitate to complete the orientation questionnaire on Mes Conseils Covid or call your doctor.

If you have symptoms compatible with COVID-19, you can also update your status in the "Isolation recommendation" module, in order to know if your isolation period should be updated.
risk.section.isolate.title: Isolate yourself
risk.section.isolate.body:
To calculate the needed duration of isolation according to your situation and to protect others, you can go to the "Isolation recommendation" module.

You can benefit from a sick leave with the Assurance Maladie.

Be sure to limit your contacts, especially with people at risk of severe disease. Be extremely vigilant about strict compliance with preventive measures.

risk0.section1.title: Your risk
risk0.section1.body:
You have not been near a user who tested positive and contagious.

You will be notified if you have been in the vicinity (estimated distance to be within two meters) of a user declared to be a case of COVID-19.

Your status in the app is checked approximately every 24 hours.

TousAntiCovid will then give you the recommendations of Minist√®re des Solidarit√©s et de la Sant√©.

risk1.details.title: No at-risk exposure detected, but stay alert

risk1.section1.body:
You have not been near a user who tested positive and contagious, but you regularly come across positive and contagious people.

You will be notified if you have been nearby (estimated distance to be less than two meters) or in the same at-risk vennue as a user declared as a case of COVID-19.

risk2.details.title: You went to a place with a moderate risk of contamination
risk2.details.sub: Get tested and apply the preventive measures!
risk2.section1.title: Your risk
risk2.section1.body:
You have been exposed to a moderate risk of contamination following your presence in the same place as a contagious person who has declared themselves positive in the application.

The contact date displayed is approximate at more or less one day, to preserve the anonymity of people who test positive.

If you have any doubts, particularly about your risk exposure, contact your doctor informing him/her that you have been in a place with a moderate risk of contamination.
risk3.notif.title: Alert: place at risk
risk3.notif.sub: You have been exposed to a high risk of contamination following your presence in the same place as a contagious person. If you are a minor, discuss it with your parents or legal guardians.

risk3.section1.title: Your risk
risk3.section1.body:
You have been exposed to a high risk of contamination following your presence in the same place as a contagious person who has tested positive in the application. You are a at-risk contact person.

The contact date displayed is approximate at more or less one day, to preserve the anonymity of people who test positive.

If you have any doubts, particularly about your risk exposure, contact your doctor informing him/her that you have been in a place with a moderate risk of contamination.
risk4.notif.title: Alert: at-risk exposure

risk4.home.title: Alert: high risk exposure following contact

risk4.section1.title: Your risk
risk4.section1.body:
You have been exposed to at least one user who has tested positive and contagious. You are a at-risk contact person.

The contact date displayed is approximate at more or less one day, to preserve the anonymity of people who test positive.

If you have the slightest doubt about your risk exposure, contact your doctor informing him/her that you have been in the vicinity of at least one user who tested positive and contagious.

walletController.title: Wallet
walletController.explanations.title: How does it work?
walletController.explanations.subtitle:
To digitalize your test and vaccination certificates and always have them at hand, it's simple:
- for your tests, you will receive a text message from SI-DEP platform with instructions.
- for your vaccination, you will have a QR Code to scan on your paper certificate. From the second half of May, you will be able to collect your old vaccination certificates.

These certificates will have to be presented during checks for your travels üëâ experimentation in progress, airlines and shipping companies will inform their eligible customers.

If you have a problem, you can call 0 800 08 71 48.

To digitalize your test and vaccination certificates and always have them at hand, it's simple:

üëâ for your tests, you will receive a text message from SI-DEP platform with instructions.

üëâ for your vaccination, you will have a QR Code to scan on your paper certificate. End of May, you will be able to collect your old vaccination certificates.

venuesRecording.whenToUse.subtitle:
The venues with these QR Codes have it either at the entrance, or in more approriate places to scan a QR Code.

If you don't find the QR Code, you can ask the staff to help you.
venuesRecording.alert.title: The alerts
venuesRecording.alert.subtitle:
If a person later tests positive, all people will be informed that they may have been exposed to the virus and will be invited to be tested.

If three people or more have been in the same place and then test positive, all the other people present in this place will be considered as contacts (because co-exposed) and invited to isolate themselves, to be tested.
